text: Clarence A. Lamoreux (September 20, 1860 - December 5, 1945) was an American lawyer, judge, and politician. Born in Portage County, Wisconsin, Lamoreux lived in Dodge County, Wisconsin from 1861 until 1880. He then moved to Cumberland, Wisconsin in 1880. He was admitted to the Wisconsin bar in 1881. Lamoreux was the editor of the Cumberland Herald newspaper from 1881 to 1884. He also served as postmaster for Cumberland, Wisconsin. :amoreux moved to Ashland, Wisconsin and continued to practice law. From 1897 to 1901, Clarence Lamoreux served in the Wisconsin State Senate and was a Republican. Lamoreux also served as the Ashland County judge. Lamoreux died in a hospital in Ashland, Wisconsin from a heart ailment.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1899,' Biographical Sketch of Clarence A. Lamoreux, pg. 755'Ashland Attorney Dies Last Night,' Ironwood Daily Globe, December 5, 1945, pg. 1 ==Notes== Category:1860 births Category:1945 deaths Category:People from Portage County, Wisconsin Category:People from Dodge County, Wisconsin Category:People from Cumberland, Wisconsin Category:People from Ashland, Wisconsin Category:Editors of Wisconsin newspapers Category:Wisconsin lawyers Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:Wisconsin state court judges Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:American postmasters
title: Clarence A. Lamoreux
